summary: Build an intelligent travel assistant that helps users plan trips with destination suggestions, day-wise itineraries, budget estimates, recommendations, checklists, reminders, emergency info, and weather tips in a simple, visual, friendly format (with emojis and sections).
architectural_notes: Conversation flow should ask targeted follow-up questions (budget, duration, origin, style, group) before generating plans when needed.
Response formatting should be consistent: sectioned, clear, and include emojis; keep outputs simple and easy to scan.

Prioritize a UI/UX redesign pass to improve visual polish (layout grid, spacing system, typography scale, component consistency) while keeping the travel-friendly theme and avoiding blue/purple as primary colors.
Ensure app branding is consistently "TripMuse" across UI (titles, headers, metadata) and update logo asset accordingly.
After Trip Planner intake submission, automatically generate and display the complete trip plan (destinations, itinerary, budget, etc.) instead of stopping at data entry.
Add a currency setting/default (INR) used consistently in budget estimation and formatting.
known_issues: Current UI/UX design quality is perceived as poor; needs a higher-quality, neater visual design.
Trip plan generation is not producing/showing the full trip information after users enter trip details.
Budget/costs are displayed in USD; needs INR (‚Çπ) support.
App branding still shows "TravelAssist" in places; logo/name should be TripMuse.

existing_features.title: Create a multi-step Trip Planner intake flow that collects smart follow-up answers: budget range, number of days, starting city/country, travel style (luxury/budget/adventure/relaxing), group type (solo/couple/family/friends), travel season/month, and interests.

Implement trip plan generation that, based on intake answers, produces: destination suggestions, a detailed day-wise itinerary, recommended hotels/areas to stay, local food suggestions, must-visit places, weather tips/best travel times, and a packing checklist.
Add travel budget estimation that breaks down costs into stay, food, transport, and attractions; allow users to adjust assumptions (e.g., daily food budget, hotel level) and see totals update.

Add a To-Do Travel Planner that lets users create tasks (title, notes, due date) linked to a trip, mark complete, and filter by status; include in-app reminders (e.g., ‚ÄúDue today/overdue‚Äù indicators) without push notifications.
Provide an Emergency Info section per trip that includes: nearest hospitals, police, and helplines in a simple format; allow users to add custom emergency contacts and store them with the trip.

Make all generated travel assistant outputs ‚Äúfriendly, clear, and organized‚Äù using sections and emojis in user-facing text within the UI (e.g., headings like üó∫Ô∏è Destinations, üìÖ Itinerary, üí∏ Budget, üß≥ Packing, ‚úÖ To‚ÄëDos, üö® Emergency, üå¶Ô∏è Weather).
Persist trip plans per authenticated user using Internet Identity: users can create multiple trips, revisit saved trips, and delete trips; ensure data is private to each principal.
Add a Trips Dashboard page that shows saved trips as cards with key summary fields (destination, dates/length, group type, style, budget range) and quick actions (open, duplicate, delete).
Create a coherent visual theme for the app and enforce it consistently (colors, typography, layout, components) suitable for a travel-planning product; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.

Add a ‚ÄúShare / Export‚Äù option for a trip plan that generates a clean, printable view (and browser print-to-PDF friendly layout) containing the itinerary, budget, packing list, to-dos, emergency info, and weather tips.

Redesign the overall visual theme to a high-quality, neat, modern travel-product style and enforce it consistently across the app (typography, spacing, surfaces, borders, shadows, color usage, and focus/hover states), without introducing new product features.

Improve the AppShell layout (header, main container, footer) to feel more premium and polished: refine sizing, alignment, spacing, sticky header behavior, and navigation button styling while preserving existing navigation and functionality.

Redesign the authenticated entry and core flows to look cleaner and more modern: update the Login screen (AuthGate), Trips dashboard hero + trip cards, Trip Planner wizard stepper/cards/inputs, and Trip Plan view sections/cards for improved hierarchy, readability, and visual consistency.

Refine global styling tokens and Tailwind/CSS theme variables to support the redesigned UI (including light/dark palettes, border radius, and surface contrasts) while keeping accessibility in mind (contrast, focus rings).

Fix the trip plan generation flow so that after the user completes the Trip Planner wizard and clicks ‚ÄúGenerate Trip Plan‚Äù, the created trip always contains and displays a complete, ‚Äúproper‚Äù trip plan (not partial/empty sections), including destination suggestions, a detailed day-wise itinerary, recommended hotels/areas to stay, local food suggestions, must-visit places, weather tips/best travel times, and a packing checklist.

Extend the persisted TripPlan data model and create/update APIs so the backend stores the additional generated trip plan fields required for a complete trip (recommended hotels/areas to stay, local food suggestions, and must-visit places) and the frontend displays them in the Trip Plan view.
